s.text: Novelist Lucian Truscott IV, a former Army officer and son and grandson of generals, writes a NYT op-ed in support of the Clinton administration's latest assault weapons ban.

The deal boldly challenges all this, says the WP , putting pressure on Congress and regulators to change the status quo, in the next five years before the deal goes into full effect.
In addition, notes the Journal , creating a huge full-service financial edifice flies in the face of the trend toward discount brokerage firms and cheap on-line trading.
As has become common in merger reporting, some of the papers attempt to cloak the event in intrigue and drama.
